answers.answer: Sounds like your doctor is looking our for pre eclampsia. Your doctor will monitor you and your baby very closely. You'll only have to be induced if your docotor sees a change that is bad. Like your blood pressure getting higher or your baby's showing signs of distress. You probably will want to stay away from high of sodium foods. That might help with your blood pressure. Drink lots of water and if you start seeing spots or feeling dizzy, getting really bad headaches, or swelling excessively, then let your doctor know right away.
I have been having a bad headache all day but i havent taken anything for it my baby has been kicking and having movement but its hard for me to breathe at time do u think i should go to the er????
Yes go jn to get checked. if you can't breath to well that's another sign. Better safe than sorry. Pre eclampsia is something you don't want to mess with or wait out.
Yes, go in to get checked. Better safe than sorry. You don't want to mess around with pre eclampsia.

Thank u ladies i did go gwt check and was admitted with severe preeclampsia and so far after steriod shots and seizure meds i am now mild preeclampsia so i can how my baby until 37weeks as longs as my bp does not go up. I was really scared at first and they recommend for me to saty at the hospital until 37weeks but i am only 31 weeks and have little kids at home so it is not realistic for me but i will be monitoring at home. Thanks again for everyone support.

question: I am 30 and work full time all my visits have been good with good bloodpressure readings but my last visit my blood pressure was 146/86 and now i have to do 24 urine collection and labs what does this mean my doctor said it can turn into me being seen every week instead of 2weeks is that bad does this mean i can be induced and she also said i measured big and was worried of too much fluid in the placenta???? Please let me know if anyone has had this happen to them...
title: high bloodpressure
